messageBody:
On Tuesday 22 February 2005 11:48, Johannes Link wrote:
> > > Actually, I don't have plain scripts, the DDL statements are in
> > > an Ant
> > > build file (using the sql-task), but it's no problem to extract
> > > them.
> > > Is there a convenient way to execute these scripts from a junit
> > > test?
> >
> > There's JDBC. It's not very convenient, but it works. :)
>
> Or you can just use the ANT-Task-Class programmatically; an easy to
> use wrapper around org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.SQLExec can be
> programmed in a few minutes.

Hi Johannes,

when I wrote the test decorator yesterday I actually looked at the Ant
task and considered doing what you suggest. For the time being I went
with the simplest thing that works, i.e., stuffing the script file's
entire contents into Statement#execute().

Michael
